title: Russian billionaire replaces all artwork in his £65m mansion with flatscreen TVs - for a very specific reason
text:
When you're worth £1.2 billion , you can afford to do some crazy things . Like replace all the artwork in your San Francisco mansion with flatscreen TVs.
And that's exactly what Russian richman Yuri Milner did: deck his crib out with 50 high-tech tellies.
We're no stranger to Mr. Milner, he's the same chap that teamed up with Stephen Hawking to fund the search for alien life .
And the reason for his gogglebox spending spree is similarly space-themed.
He reportedly wants every single screen to display streams from NASA's Kepler space telescope.
This is a Google aerial view of the 18-acre estate, which sits on a hilltop with panoramic views of the San Francisco Bay.
For entertainment, the chateau also contains a home theater (shown) and a spa/gym.
The master bedroom suite is in the south wing.
Mr. Milner revealed his plans to an audience at a Wall Street Journal event at Laguna Beach, California.
He also explained that he wears the same outfits over and over again so he doesn't waste time deciding what to put on in the morning.
"I'm just trying to simplify my life to every extent possible. If you limit your choices, you can spend more time doing something else," he said.
Mr. Milner currently works as an investor and has earned millions from backing technology giants like Facebook, Instagram and Twitter.
The kitchen of Milner's estate, which also has a formal dining room, a ballroom and a wine cellar.
The front facade of Milner's mansion, known as Palo Alto Loire Chateau. Its design is inspired by 18th-century French architecture.
The living room of the 25,000-square-foot mansion.
